p: The first EPA outbreak was reported after a 12-day exercise (February 29–March 11, 2016). Forty-four personnel from a combat unit of 128 sought care at the Regimental Aid Post (RAP) with rash, headache, nausea, fatigue, lethargy, and joint and muscle pain at the conclusion of the exercise. RRV IgM was detected in acute- or convalescent-phase serum samples collected from 28 of these 44 persons 14–50 days after symptom onset ( Table); attack rates ranged from 22% (confirmed cases only, 28/128 [22%]) to 34% (all suspected cases, 44/128 [34%]) ( Figure 1, panel A).
